text: BBC News - Brexit march: Hundreds of thousands join referendum protest
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: When @ScotParl moved to Holyrood, Norway gifted this beautiful tapestry - so it was great to view it again yesterday with Norwegian parliamentarian @Easybring_Heidi @AlynSmith and @Mariot_Leslie former UK Ambassador to Oslo - all speakers at our @SP_European seminar
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Paul I'd no knowledge of this thread till you tagged me. The thread consists of abusive comments, by people with a record of online hyperbole, which I assume you wished me to see. My responses are factual. In future, if you dont want a response, dont tag.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Try speaking to actual intersex/DSD people @RaeUK @MRKHvoice or look at https://www.dsdfamilies.org/charity  with lived experience who explain that people with these conditions are male or female. DSD is not an identity and should not be conflated with gender identity
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Wonderful to co-host seminar to mark 20th anniversary of ⁦@ScotParl⁩  & ⁦⁦@EUparliament⁩ office in Scotland with ⁦@CCC_Research⁩ Fantastic panellists Sir Ivan Roges, ⁦@Mariot_Leslie⁩ ⁦#brexit
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Suggest you read the oral evidence from data users and statisticians re the census - the Office of National Statisttics @ONS support binary sex question for equality purposes. You can read their EQIA reasoning here
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Your hysterical comments completely misrepresent my position and the position of many women Gregor. You've got into trouble attacking women in the past on social media. Maybe think about that ?
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: This cannot be separated from the PM's appalling alt right speech attacking MPs
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Yes, it was a rather bizarre line of questioning given the crisis we are facing!
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Thanks Paul, hope you are doing well
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: None of that is true. Like many other people I want a balance that preserves everyone's right to safety, privacy, dignity and fairness. But we will leave it there as we clearly will not agree.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I also never made any comment about your child or yourself as I don't know either of you. All children should be respected and protected. My point earlier was a general one about aduly offending rates which is supported by leading criminologists
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: There is no evidence that men who self ID as women have different offending patterns from men as a whole. . Also women's consent should be sought before male bodied individuals share intimate spaces/service Women have a right to set boundries.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I never said any such thing. I said men  commit 84% of violent crime and 95% + sexual crime. This is a fact, even though the majority of men and all the men I am close to are lovely. So that's why women are allowed to keep men out of their private spaces
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: About to do BBC The Nine with @PaulJSweeney to talk about #brexitshambes #RevokeArticle50Now
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I have never at any time suggested what Natasha York claims - which is why she has failed to link to any evidence backing her slanderous allegations. Every human being deserves respect and equality
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Good. And for the record my tweet did not question the film festival or its inclusion policies. I questioned the use of the term "womxn" by @screenscots a public agency. Let's hope it's a one off, as it alienates more folk than it includes.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I believe that women have a right to define themselves and their own boundries and their protections in the Equality Act 2010 should be upheld. Do you?
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: You didn't answer my question. Do you think "women" is not inclusive? Should be dropped? Perfectly legitimate to question use of "womxn"- it has been criticised before as in @ExploreWellcome
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I am criticising the use of the term womxn, not the festival itself, which I am sure is excellent.  Your logic here suggests that you think the word women is not inclusive? That it shouldn't be used? I hope not.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Sadly not a typo..other organisations have used this term in the mistaken belief that it is more inclusive - eg @ExploreWellcome  apologised after being criticised for doing same thing. See here
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Feminism is not fascism...Your silly hyperbole exposes your own intolerance and demeans the crimes of actual fascists - read some history.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: It is perfectly possible to be inclusive without eradicating half the population - womxn is a ridiculous woke insult.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Tell @screenscots what you think of their female erasure. Womxn is an insult. We should be able to define ourselves on our own terms. #WarOnWomen
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: womxn ? Are you being delibrately offensive? #WarOnWomen
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Suggest you read the committee census report on which actually introduces a trans question for the first time - very opposite of "erasure". Sex Self ID however masks trans people making it more dfficult to evaluate their needs & deliver services.  https://www.parliament.scot/parliamentarybusiness/CurrentCommittees/109902.aspx …
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: As I made clear Tom, I had an  engagement with parents of children with epilepsy in D&G who are campaigning for a specialist nurse as @epilepsy_scot will confirm. I do not ditch constituents at the last minute, no matter how good a news story it might be
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Fantastic news!
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Excellent event tonight @ScotParl with @SRUC  @EmmaHarperMSP and @JohnSwinney - so much good R&D, like the soil science pictured here at #crichtoncampus and development of food and drink products across Scotland #strawberryvinegar yum!
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Marvellous obituary @heraldscotland of Paul Scott, by Alan Riach. "a fine strategist dedicated to a great vision of a nation reborn with its people in full possession of their cultural history and multifaceted identity."
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Thank you, I an taking DSDFamilies concerns forward as best I can
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: A good starting point for anyone wanting to know more is the website of DSDFamilies, https://www.dsdfamilies.org   People who have these conditions, as @MRKHvoice does
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Would love to be at the #Pinneys announcement today in #Annan to congratulate all in @scotgov & @dgcouncil who worked so hard. But I'm committed to a meeting with local parents of children with epilepsy, to discuss important matter of specialist nursing @epilepsy_scot
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Great work by SNP government and @dgcouncil whose joint Action group has secured a buyer for #pinneys plant in #Annan. Not all jobs can be replaced but I am told potential to grow workforce to 300
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Thanks, and you - you were one of the first voices I heard on this subject thanks to my gbf @TwisterFilm
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Thanks Kath
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Noted
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Finally if we are to have a respectful discussion, all voices must be heard. I hope @RBFMaguire is one of them. She is is a fantastic role model for women and a great champion of equalities.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Similarly @jonnnybest, a gay man & founder of Queer up North, has written powerfully about how Stonewall's approach is problematic, especially for lesbians - read it here
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: But many gay people, such as @SimonFanshawe a founder of @stonewalluk worry about the direction it is taking re trans matters. Simon isn't toxic either
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: For the record I always supported Stonewall. I voted for equal marriage and am a long term ally of gay rights - I've spoken out against homophobia since I was a teenager, which wasn't yesterday.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: I assume @paulhutcheon as an investigative journalist would not agree that it is toxic for the media to report and comment on these matters of public interest as his colleagues @iainmacwhirter and @shonacraven have done.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: There is nothing "toxic" about pointing this out. Nothing "toxic" in @Martina asking for fairness in female sport. Nothing "toxic" raising concerns about male sex offences categorised as female across the UK
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Also worth repeating that @stonewalluk along with @ScottishTrans asked @WomenEqualities for an end to women's protections in the Equality Act
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: @StonewallScot have the means and opportunities to make their case. Along with @ScottishTrans and @LGBTIScotland they receive significant public funding. All support self-id and lobby media & MSPs to back it, though many MSPs I speak to have concerns
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Trans people rightly have legal protections in hate crime laws & Equality Act. But it's not "toxic" , as @StonewallScot implicitly suggest to @heraldscotland, to discuss how allowing any man to self ID as a female affects women's protections in Equality Act.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: So someone appears to have trawled my thread for "likes" and then gone to the media to try to shut down discussion by targetting @RBFMaguire . As academic @lnmackenzie1 says, this is very worrying
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: My thread, which this @paulhutcheon story refers to, was liked 2000 times, shared by 800 people & widely praised as balanced & respectful - presumably why @RBFMaguire liked it too. Read it here
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: For clarity, @SP_European committee findings DID back a new transgender question in 2021 Census, but sensibly supported retaining a binary m/f sex question -for planning services like health, as statisticians like @susanmcvie & @ONS made clear.
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: It's not a good look to attempt to bully and shame another woman simply because she welcomed a discussion about the consequences of replacing biological sex with self-declared "gender identity" @heraldscotland @RBFMaguire
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Happy St Patrick's Day!
author: JoanMcAlpine

text: Pat's beautiful tribute to his mum, whom we said goodbye to yesterday.
author: JoanMcAlpine
